column4: if I recall skype did some auto volume setting so I wonder if it changed some volume setting you don't see?
That's what I'm guessing. I wonder how I can reset ALL audio settings to the defaults. The defaults worked great for me before.
I look at my sound on UB 11.10 and I don't see any mixer settings so maybe you need a mixer installed to even see all the settings
well that's true... but ... what do I install? alsamixergui doesn't do much apparently
I'm not sure I just installed this version, my 10.04 had one but forget name
I just installed gnome alsa mixer, just so I have one, it seems to have settings I've never even seen before like headphone enable
I will try that one, thanks.
what worries me is that the mic works for a second, and then when accessed by an application, it fails.
oh that doesn't sound like a mixer thing then, i'm not sure
the record part is the capture settings
but Rec. is checked already, and it didn't seem to do anything
oh there is another setting for mic boost on some sound cards
yeah I saw that. The problem though isn't the volume, it's that I can't actually USE the mic in anything
without mic boost on my mike I don't hear anything,  but ya you said it works in feed back so that can't be it eather
well and it's not the boost, it's that it's literally unrecognized as a recording device after a second
might want to take a peak at what your audio card is with sudo lspci  and see if any others are having problems with it, if you didn't check that already
I'm not sure, I think it's an unnamed ATI, i.e. Device 17xx, and the problem is that it *worked* before - Skype changed some stupid setting somewhere and now it doesn't.
take a closer look at sudo lspci and google with added skype in search
